snippet: In recent years, several of Manhattan’s Class B buildings, typically known for being old and out of the way, have acted to improve their carbon footprints.
abstract: Several of Manhattan’s Class B office buildings, typically known for being old and out of the way, in last few years have acted to shrink their carbon footprints; analysts say while landlords find it difficult to recoup what they spend on green features from their tenants, energy savings can be significant.
lead_paragraph: In recent years, several of Manhattan’s Class B buildings, typically known for being old and out of the way, have acted to improve their carbon footprints.

headline.main: Manhattan’s Second-Tier Office Buildings Make Energy Efficiency a Goal
headline.print_headline: Second-Tier Office Sites Going Green in Manhattan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)
